definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: I heard the roar of the gun salute, then the sound earth-shaking.
sentences.chinese: 我听到了礼炮的轰鸣，那声音惊天动地。

sentences.english: Evenif you travel in ideal weather, sea journeys take along time.
sentences.chinese: 即使惊天动地，坐船旅行也要占用很长时间。

sentences.english: Struggle of course is not necessarily earth-shattering, but it must be worthy of the heart.
sentences.chinese: 奋斗的历程不一定是惊天动地，但一定是无愧于心。

sentences.english: In childhood, I thought you were very mysterious, said a few words were also earthshaking.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，我以为你很神奇，说上一句话也惊天动地。

sentences.english: Peng Chu industrious hands with earth-shattering volume history books.
sentences.chinese: 用勤劳的双手捧出一卷惊天动地的史书。

sentences.english: Always waiting for a chance to create a "world-shattering second".
sentences.chinese: 一直期待制造“惊天动地的一秒”。

sentences.english: An earthshaking genie narcissists, word of all three ErNvQingChang.
sentences.chinese: 一场惊天动地的人妖之恋，道尽了三界的儿女情长。

sentences.english: That chaotic environment produced the occasional literally Earth-shattering collision.
sentences.chinese: 在混乱的环境会不时发生惊天动地的碰撞。

sentences.english: Then with a shocking bang, half of the ice mountain was blasted away.
sentences.chinese: 然后，随着一声惊天动地的巨响，半座冰山被炸飞了。

sentences.english: Yes, I believed we could act flowers in the same tree, was a earth-shattering.
sentences.chinese: 没错，相信我们能如一树繁花，开得惊天动地。
那一刹那是惊天动地的。

sentences.english: The symbol of youth, in the moment of shaking heaven and earth solidified into a sad note.
sentences.chinese: 青春的符号，在惊天动地的那一刻凝固成悲音。

definition: heaven falls and earth rends (idiom); rocked by a major disaster/fig. violent revolution/major social upheaval
the earth quaked, the mountains shook (idiom); a tremendous battle
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
